page.title: 19'RED LION INN'
page.content: At East Fossil Farm they used to make Caerphilly Cheese as late as 1958,but with the new regulations the licence was withdrawn.The word"Fossil"is a corruption of "Fuzzhill"."Fuzz"being the local name for gorse bushes,which still grow abundantly especially on the heath. At the junction of the village street and the A352 main road stands the 'Red Lion Inn'.Outside is a telephone box. The inn was once a coaching halt but parts of it date back to the 15th. Century,and were built of cob and thatch.The thatch had just been rethatched in 1965 when it caught fire The inn now has a tiled roof and only the 'Pool Room'has a thatch. It does a good trade in meals especially at lunch times.
